Summary I am a Supply Demand Analyst in Intel’s CPU Supply Demand Planning Organization where I have held almost every available Planning position over the last 8 years. My organization is responsible for scheduling the production of Intel’s FAB and Assembly Test sites around the world by considering demand and developing inventory strategies to suit the business environments of our markets.  
 
Holding roles including Supply Demand Analyst, Business Planner, Team Manager, Supply Analyst, and Lead Planner, I have worked with Intel’s factories on supply and quality issues, with sales and marketing on demand and inventory forecasts, with engineers on product health forecasts, and with finance on inventory control. And in this work my key contribution has been to develop tools, systems, and processes to support the work of my organization so that each interaction in the future becomes easier and more productive. 
 
I have a BS in Business Administration and an MBA focused on Global Supply Chain Management. Before earning my MBA I was a production manager at a service company then I spent two years in the Peace Corps as a Small Business Development volunteer. 
 
I am focused on continuous improvement, I constantly assess our planning systems and tools and initiate improvements. I am result oriented, I understand the business and prioritize my work appropriately to maximize my contributions. I am a strong team member, I have demonstrated the ability to lead a team through multiple challenges. I have a positive attitude and strong trust across my organization.
